body.prompt:
Generate a fake conversation between a customer and an agent.
The agent should introduce themselves, their company and give the customer
their name. The agent should ask for the customer's name.
As part of the conversation, have the agent ask for two pieces of
personal information.  Spell out numbers. For example, 1000 should be
said as one zero zero zero, not one thousand. The conversation should be
at least 10 lines long and be complete. At the end
of the conversation, the agent should thank the customer for their time
and end the conversation. Return the conversation formatted 
like the following example:

{'conversation': 
    [
    {'speaker': 'Agent', 'message': 'xxxxx'}, 
    {'speaker': 'Customer', 'message': "xxxxx."}, 
    {'speaker': 'Agent', 'message': "xxxxxx"}
    ] 
}

body.speaker: Agent
body.message: Hello, my name is Jose Baker and I represent Starlight Hotels. May I have your name, please?

body.speaker: Agent
body.message: Thank you, Tammy. I understand you are experiencing loud noise from your neighbors. Could you please provide me with your room number so I can address this issue?

body.speaker: Customer
body.message: I'm staying in room three two zero.

body.speaker: Agent
body.message: Thank you, Tammy. Can you also share your phone number so we can update you on the progress of resolving the noise disturbance?

body.speaker: Customer
body.message: My phone number is five five five, six seven eight, nine zero one two.

body.speaker: Agent
body.message: Thank you for providing that information, Tammy. We will work on resolving the noise issue in room three two zero and keep you updated. Is there anything else I can assist you with today?

body.speaker: Customer
body.message: No, that's all for now. Please make sure to address the noisy neighbors as soon as possible.

body.speaker: Agent
body.message: Of course, Tammy. We appreciate your patience and cooperation. Thank you for contacting us today. Have a pleasant stay.

body.speaker: Agent
body.message: You're welcome. Have a great day, Tammy. Goodbye.
